title: Error
description: RFC7807 error model for all publiq APIs.

type.description: A URI reference that identifies the problem type. Can be used to recognize specific errors in your application code by comparing the complete URI.

title.description: A short, human-readable summary of the problem type (for developers).

detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem (for developers).

endUserMessage.description: A human-readable explanation of the problem, specifically for end-users, in one or more languages. Usually set for domain errors, but not for errors caused by a technical issue in the integration (for example invalid JSON syntax in a request body). An `nl` value is always provided, other languages may be provided depending on the API and its intended audience.

nl.description: A human-readable explanation of the problem, specifically for end-users, localized in Dutch.

fr.description: A human-readable explanation of the problem, specifically for end-users, localized in French.

de.description: A human-readable explanation of the problem, specifically for end-users, localized in German.

en.description: A human-readable explanation of the problem, specifically for end-users, localized in English.

schemaErrors.description: A list of one or more schema validation errors (usually used for error type https://api.publiq.be/probs/body/invalid-data).

jsonPointer.description: RFC6901 compliant pointer that indicates what property/value was invalid.

error.description: A human-readable (but often technical) reason why the property was invalid.
